column4: I want to put the Ubuntu repository of i386 packages on my iPod so I can upgrade at home. What's the easy way?
I want all i386 packages from main, multiverse, restricted, and universe. How can I do this?
download the iso to the ipod, then install from the iso
The ISO doesn't have the other pools like multivers and universe
yes, it does not.
I want them.

well, you will have to download them by hand then. You are not gonna download all of universe and multivers. you can find out what packages you have installd with sudo dpkg -l at home, and then download newest versions of all your packages at packages.ubuntu.com
That's a lot of packages to download by hand, even if I *knew* what needed to be upgraded.
no
does google?
There was one link, but it's dead. Everything else, nothing knows.
visit the components page about ubuntu.
go read the components page
so it does hd(4,X)?
No, it does root=/dev/hdd2, when it should be root=/dev/hdb2
in menu.lst?
grub reads the /boot/grub/menu.lst file, afaik.
Yes, now what does update-grub read?
the man page does not talk about it?
I've been searching for an hour (and I've read the man page)
afaik also, it should also not read device nodes, but devices
when you run update-grub, do you have hdd mounted as root? you need to chroot, then.
